content: We are pleased to announce that @Dave Hamill will be available to offer support for zoom so if you have any questions ask here!
Just confirming that the individual accounts for the tracks have the 40 minute limitation...
I hope the limit isn't 40 minutes -- we were planning on keeping it on all day. @Sandra Vance ?
The Zoom accounts are licensed accounts, meaning the a session can be up to 24 hours
:+1:
@Mark Kramer We have set up Pro Accounts which will not be limited to 40 minutes. They will run from 9am to 7pm Thursday and Friday.
Can they run longer if we want them to? What about on Wednesday?

@Sandra Vance @Dave Hamill Just Thursday and Friday sounds like a problem. Will these lines work:

  1. Wednesday before the start time?
  2. Wednesday after the start time?
  3. After seven p.m. and before nine a.m.?

@Michael Donnelly The zoom accounts are set up by track with the track leads hosting. You can meet with your track whenever you like. We just ask that you post your plan on your track page on confluence so visitors will know when things will be happening. :-)
Excellent! And will do :)
@Dave Hamill I am one of the track leads for Genomics and while I see the room listed on the Confluence document, we haven't received a password?
@Kevin Power I just forwarded you an email from Sandy that contains the Zoom information for Track Leads
@Lloyd McKenzie , yes. They will be open for 24 each day (ET) so the track leads can open them at will and keep them open for as long as needed.
Will the kick-off information be coming out soon?
@Lloyd McKenzie @Sandra Vance Lloyd, what specifically do you mean by 'kick off information'. Is it regarding Zoom?
Yes. My understanding was that we were supposed to get a notification of the Webinar link "this morning", but it's getting past morning most places and I haven't seen an email yet :)

@Dave Hamill - Yes. Should there be a "main connectathon Zoom" included on this page? The "main connectathon Zoom" is where this afternoon's kickoff is occurring, as well as the other sessions listed here.
Only the paid registrants would receive the GoToWebinar link for the kickoff. There was an email sent out to the registrants
It came from "HL7 Webinars"
It looks like it was sent around 10:40 AM Central
I'm registered and paid and I haven't seen it - not in spam or trash either
seems a few of the SANER crew also didn't get the email
@Sadhana Alangar
@Lloyd McKenzie I thought you were referring to Sandy's email that had the Zoom password so that Track Leaders could run their Track's Zoom sessions...I just forwarded that to you.

However, you're all referencing the email with the GoToWebinar credentials to join the 'general session' at 4pm today. I'll reach out to Staffers and Sandy and indicate that Lloyd nor John have received theirs to see if that can uncover any problem with it.
I got mine. but there were others on the saner connectathon track that indicated they did not get theirs
@John Moehrke can you give me a few names offhand...it's always easier to debug an issue if we have some specific examples

Dave Hamill said:

Lloyd McKenzie Sandra Vance Lloyd, what specifically do you mean by 'kick off information'. Is it regarding Zoom?

Dave - I have received three emails from people who didn't get the email I sent at 6pm yesterday that had the password info in it. I have resent it exposing emails because I am concerned it had something to do with using "BCC" to protect emails.

Regarding the GO TO Webinar info for Kick Off - that email would have been generated by @Sadhana Alangar and the email would come from Go To Webinar...
Thanks for resending the Zoom email.
Lloyd, you should have received the webinar invite
You are correct with the GTW email...it's generated via GTW
Nothing from gotowebinar. I did get Sandra's email with the Zoom passwords yesterday (and today :>)
subject was "Virtual FHIR Connectathon Confirmation"
@John Moehrke can you forward that email to webmaster@HL7.org so that @David Johnson can see exactly what it looks like when sent
Sadhana tried to resend mine specifically, but nothing came through
just got another copy
Still nada :(

Sadhana just informed Staff that she resent the GTW confirmation email to all 611 registrants. @John Moehrke received that email. @Lloyd McKenzie did not. To me, that indicates Lloyd's email server blocked it. Which means the same could've happened to many other registrants. @Lloyd McKenzie is there a way to have your tech people see if the GTW email was blocked or quarantined?
Please note that the email would have come from customercare@gotowebinar.com
Full from is "HL7 Webinars <customercare@gotowebinar.com>"

i just received an email with the GoTo"Webinar" link, however I am also wondering about Zoom? Is this a link that will be provided to us later today for the whole conference? I understand the task leaders are going to post this link somewhere in the 'confluence page.

Cynthia Barton said:

i just received an email with the GoTo"Webinar" link, however I am also wondering about Zoom? Is this a link that will be provided to us later today for the whole conference? I understand the task leaders are going to post this link somewhere in the 'confluence page.

The zoom links are posted here: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2020-05+Zoom+Info+for+Each+Track

At Epic, at least 2 registered attendee has received the gotomeeting info sent this morning and at least 6 other registered attendees have not (we're all using the same mail server/spam rules). Maybe the delivery time is staggered? There's only a few hours until the kickoff call, though.
I got it about 15 minutes ago.
Just got it! :got_it:
@Cynthia Barton are you a track lead that needs credentials to host a Zoom meetinng or a participant that needs to see the URLs to join a Zoom meeting

I'm using GMail as a server and I've received emails from HL7 gotowebinars before. It's certainly possible the emails are going out in batches - hopefully those finish soon. I still haven't received an email from the webinar, but I did receive an email from Sadhana saying to reach out to her if I didn't receive it - so hopefully everyone at least gets that one.
I hope we all get access to the recording... right?
@John Moehrke What recordings are you talking about? The GTW 'general session'? Zoom track sessions? Other?
the kickoff meeting that many have not received the GTM details for (and some of us have day-job conflicts).
That's what I thought you were referencing ...I just didn't want to assume.
I'm on the GTW practice session with Sandy and others now and will confirm
Confirmed! They will record the kick off meeting and will let people know how to access it (as to 'how' that will be done -- via email, link on Confluence, link elsewhere...I'm not exactly sure)
Not a track lead. Participant. needs to see the URLs to join a Zoom meeting
I just got the link from gotowebinar
must have gotten caught at the Canadian boarder...
@Cynthia Barton they're linked off the main connectathon page: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIR/2020-05+Zoom+Info+for+Each+Track
